dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hah! Oh man, did you read this? Just, oh, wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hah! Oh man, did you read this? Just, oh, wow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What, are you just seeing what you want to see again? Because, um, I actually read it properly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What, are you just seeing what you want to see again? Because, um, I actually read it properly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Properly? Are you kidding me? "A spectacular bust," that's what it says! And "this time it's different" because, uh, demand's fallen!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Properly? Are you kidding me? A spectacular bust, that's what it says! And this time it's different because, uh, demand's fallen!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That first flush of demand for mining and exploration companies exposed to lithium, graphite, cobalt and nickel ended in a spectacular bust because metal supply significantly outstripped demand for EVs. ... This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising as seen in last years 36% increase in Tesla sales

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it says that was the last time. It says "this time it is different." It's like, a correction, right? Not a total collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it says that was the last time. It says this time it is different. It's like, a correction, right? Not a total collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising as seen in last years 36% increase in Tesla sales despite the depressing effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on global mobility and overall vehicle demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A correction? Thirty-six percent drop in Tesla sales? And, uh, their stock price down fifteen percent? That's not a "correction," that's a nosedive, buddy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A correction? Thirty-six percent drop in Tesla sales? And, uh, their stock price down fifteen percent? That's not a correction, that's a nosedive, buddy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising as seen in last years 36% increase in Tesla sales... the shift towards EVs has accelerated and can be seen in Teslas 76% share price rise since early November from $400 a share to $705.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but Tesla is, like, still losing ground because everyone else is finally stepping up. That's competition, not the end of EVs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but Tesla is, like, still losing ground because everyone else is finally stepping up. That's competition, not the end of EVs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Tesla is the current EV leader, it is being joined in the race to overtake internal combustion engines by traditional vehicle leaders, such as Mercedes Benz, Toyota, Ford and Audi. Increasing competition for EV sales...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Stepping up to hydrogen, not necessarily electric! Mercedes, Toyota, Ford – they're shifting, right? Away from EVs, not towards them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Stepping up to hydrogen, not necessarily electric! Mercedes, Toyota, Ford - they're shifting, right? Away from EVs, not towards them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Tesla is the current EV leader, it is being joined in the race to overtake internal combustion engines by traditional vehicle leaders, such as Mercedes Benz, Toyota, Ford and Audi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hydrogen is like, a side note. The main thing is the long-term shift. Charging stations, range anxiety – those are being overcome, the article says!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hydrogen is like, a side note. The main thing is the long-term shift. Charging stations, range anxiety - those are being overcome, the article says!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Increasing competition for EV sales, as obstacles such as limited charging stations and range anxiety are overcome, is being boosted by government incentives for drivers to make the switch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then it immediately says government disincentives are thwarting it! And forget Tesla for a second, what about the miners? Pilbara, Albemarle, down ten percent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then it immediately says government disincentives are thwarting it! And forget Tesla for a second, what about the miners? Pilbara, Albemarle, down ten percent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Increasing competition for EV sales, as obstacles such as limited charging stations and range anxiety are overcome, is being boosted by government incentives for drivers to make the switch. ... Pilbara Minerals, an Australian producer of lithium, is up 137% since early November. ... U.S.-based Albemarle Corporation has enjoyed a 58% share price rise since November 4

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A small company, Pilbara, relative to Tesla's market cap, losing value faster isn't, um, a shock. That's just how small cap stocks work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A small company, Pilbara, relative to Tesla's market cap, losing value faster isn't, um, a shock. That's just how small cap stocks work.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While its easier for a relatively small company valued at $1.8 billion to rise faster than Tesla with its $670 billion stock market value, the double-your-money win in just eight weeks is very real for Pilbara shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Goldman Sachs cutting lithium forecasts by, like, a third? Spodumene from $395 to $300? That's them saying the bottom is falling out!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Goldman Sachs cutting lithium forecasts by, like, a third? Spodumene from three hundred ninety five dollars to three hundred dollars? That's them saying the bottom is falling out!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Goldman Sachs, late last month, lifted its forecasts for lithium. Spodumene (a primary ore of the metal) is tipped to rise from $395 a ton to $536/t this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a recalibration, though! Not, like, the whole market disappearing. The initial demand was, uh, overblown, so prices are adjusting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a recalibration, though! Not, like, the whole market disappearing. The initial demand was, uh, overblown, so prices are adjusting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That first flush of demand for mining and exploration companies exposed to lithium, graphite, cobalt and nickel ended in a spectacular bust because metal supply significantly outstripped demand for EVs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oversupply. It's literally the last line. "Potentially exposing an oversupply of some critical metals." That's a huge problem for future investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oversupply. It's literally the last line. Potentially exposing an oversupply of some critical metals. That's a huge problem for future investment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...other vehicle makers are compounding demand growth and potentially exposing a shortage of some critical metals. If shortages do develop, battery metal prices could spike higher with a corresponding effect on share prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For future investment, maybe, but the long-term trend for EVs isn't going anywhere. This is just the bumpy road to mass adoption, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For future investment, maybe, but the long-term trend for EVs isn't going anywhere. This is just the bumpy road to mass adoption, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Bumpy road? More like a cliff edge for these companies. It's 2017 all over again, but worse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bumpy road? More like a cliff edge for these companies. It's twenty seventeen all over again, but worse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising as seen in last years 36% increase in Tesla sales despite the depressing effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on global mobility and overall vehicle demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You always see the worst. This is just the market correcting itself before the next big surge. It's, um, healthy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You always see the worst. This is just the market correcting itself before the next big surge. It's, um, healthy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Healthy? They're calling it a 'crash' in the article! A crash!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Healthy? They're calling it a 'crash' in the article! A crash!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The battery metals crash, which lasted until early this year, was a classic demonstration of arriving too early at a partywhich can be worse than being last to leave.
